label: 御陰参り
本: Edo Culture: Daily Life and Diversions in Urban Japan, 1600-1868 . University of Hawai'i Press . 1997
説明文: Also known as nukemairi. Sudden mass pilgrimages to the great shrine at Ise. Most participants were members of the commoner class, who often had not received permission to go. The largest okagemairi, with some two or three million participants each, occurred in 1650, 1705, 1771, and 1830.［伊勢］
